ratings.comment: Worst professor in my four years.  Completely condescending; more focused on asserting herself as an expert than teaching. Actively discourages participation through her stubborn, unenthusiastic demeanor. In-class instructions are unclear. Posts assignments late w/o changing the deadline. Uninspiring class discussions; shuts down students' ideas

awful. disrespectful to students. plays favorites. got a zero on an assignment, she told me to redo it for credit then never graded it. the class itself is kinda interesting but she makes it WAY too much work. terrible at communicating assignment details, so inconsistent, then gets mad at the students when they dont do it the way she wants

The worst professor I've had in four years. Her grading is inconsistent, and directions are vague, leaving students confused. She penalizes students for leaving class early but leaves early herself. Her lectures are poorly organized, repetitive, and unhelpful. Overall, an incredibly frustrating and unfair experience.
very rude and made me not want to come to class. Should have been an easy class but she made it miserable and gave wy too much work for what the class intended.

I loved her class and it was easy to get an A. Instructions can be unclear at times so make sure you ask if confused. Sometimes forgets to update or post assignments on canvas ahead of time. Harsh grader on written assignments. Dance unit tests are easy if you practice. No written exams. Put in the work (sometimes a lot) and you will succeed in 319

Very passionate about Asian and Afro culture. I loved the community of people that she created in class. Expect to spend a few hours outside of class on rehearsals and writing assignments each week. She can be a tough grader on written assignments. Can only miss 2 classes or grade will drop a letter. If you put in the work you should get an A np.

Professor's teaching style was quite disappointing. Their lectures lacked organization and clarity, making it difficult to follow along. Additionally, the professor had a tendency to go off on tangents, which wasted valuable class time. The assignments and exams were vague and did not align well with the course material.

This professor was an absolute nightmare to deal with. Their teaching style was incredibly unclear, and they seemed to have no interest in making the material accessible to students. The lectures were filled with jargon and convoluted explanations that left the entire class feeling confused and frustrated.

This professor was by far the worst I've ever had. His teaching style was incredibly dull and uninspiring. He rarely engaged with the class and seemed disinterested in the subject matter. It was difficult to stay attentive during his lectures, as he lacked the ability to convey complex ideas in a clear and concise manner.

This professor was overall disappointing in terms of their teaching style and approach. They lacked clarity in their explanations and often seemed unprepared for class. The professor rarely provided useful examples or real-life applications to enhance our understanding of the subject matter.

This professor was absolutely terrible. I couldn't stand attending their class. The lectures were boring and lacked any kind of enthusiasm. They seemed disorganized and often went off on tangents that were completely irrelevant to the subject. It was incredibly frustrating trying to follow along with their unclear explanations.

I have never been more disappointed with a professor in my entire academic career. Their teaching style was incredibly disorganized, making it difficult to follow along with the material. They often went off on tangents that had no relevance to the subject at hand, wasting valuable class time.

This professor is one of the worst I've ever had. Their teaching style is incredibly dry and boring, making it difficult to stay engaged in the material. They also tend to ramble on without making clear points, causing confusion among the students.

This was honestly one of the worst professors I've ever had. They had no enthusiasm for the subject matter and it really showed in their teaching style. The lectures were incredibly boring and lacked any kind of organization. I often found myself struggling to stay awake.

This professor was by far one of the worst I have ever had. Their teaching style was extremely ineffective and made it difficult to understand the material. They would often go off on tangents that were completely unrelated to the subject matter, wasting valuable class time.

This professor was not the greatest. They lacked clarity in their lectures and often went off on tangents that were unrelated to the course material. Their grading system was arbitrary and unclear, leaving students unsure of where they stood in the class.
I had the displeasure of taking a class with this professor and it was not a pleasant experience. Their teaching style was quite uninspiring and made it difficult to stay engaged in the material.

This professor was a nightmare to have for class. Their teaching style was incredibly dry and monotonous, making it difficult to stay engaged and interested in the material. They rarely encouraged class participation, which made it even harder to grasp the concepts being taught.

This professor was incredibly disorganized and unfocused in their teaching style. It was hard to follow along with their lectures as they often went off on tangents and failed to cover all the necessary material. Additionally, they seemed uninterested in students' questions and often brushed them off.

This professor was by far the worst I've encountered during my time at this university. Their teaching style was incredibly dry and monotonous, making it near impossible to stay engaged in the material. They seemed more interested in lecturing at us than actually facilitating any meaningful discussion or interaction.

I had a very disappointing experience with this professor. Their teaching style was incredibly disorganized and lacked structure. Additionally, their explanations were often confusing and unclear, leaving many students feeling lost.

This professor was a complete disappointment. Their teaching style was extremely disorganized, making it nearly impossible to understand the material. They rarely provided clear explanations and often went off on tangents unrelated to the subject matter.

The professor was highly disorganized and inconsistent in their teaching approach. They frequently went off on tangents, making it difficult to follow the main points of the lectures. This professor was one of the worst I have ever had. Their teaching style was incredibly boring and uninspiring. They lacked enthusiasm and didn't seem to care about the subject matter. The lectures were dull and monotonous, making it difficult to stay engaged.

I took a class with this professor and I was extremely disappointed with the way they taught. The professor lacked enthusiasm and made the lectures boring and dull. The material was already difficult to grasp, but the professor's teaching style only made it worse.

This professor was one of the worst I have ever had the displeasure of encountering. Their teaching style left much to be desired, as they failed to clearly explain complex concepts and often seemed disinterested in the subject matter. They rarely provided helpful feedback on assignments, leaving students feeling lost and unsure of how to improve.

I had the not-so-pleasant experience of being in this professor's class last semester. The overall teaching style was quite confusing and lacked clarity. It felt like the professor was not well-prepared for the lectures, often going off on tangents that only served to confuse the students further.

I had the displeasure of taking a class with this professor recently and it was a complete disaster. Their teaching style was incredibly dry and monotonous, making it nearly impossible to stay engaged in the material. I had the unfortunate experience of being taught by this professor last semester, and I have to say it was a disappointment. The professor had a tendency to go off on tangents during lectures, making it difficult to follow the main points.

This professor was a complete disappointment. Every lecture was a struggle to stay awake, as they had absolutely no energy or enthusiasm for the subject matter. It felt like they were just going through the motions and didn't care about the students' learning experience.

This professor was one of the worst I've ever had. Their teaching style was incredibly disorganized and confusing. This professor was the worst! They had absolutely no enthusiasm for teaching and it showed in their lectures. They droned on and on, making it almost impossible to stay engaged. This professor was by far one of the worst I have ever had. Their teaching style was incredibly disorganized and confusing, making it difficult to follow along during lectures. They frequently went off on tangents that were completely unrelated to the subject matter, wasting valuable class time.

This professor was absolutely terrible. Their teaching style was so boring and monotone, it was impossible to stay engaged in the class. The professor I had was absolutely terrible. Their teaching style was dull and monotonous, making it difficult to stay engaged in the material. They lacked enthusiasm and seemed disinterested in the subject matter, which was reflected in their lectures.

This professor was one of the worst I've had during my time at college. Their teaching style was outdated and confusing, making it extremely difficult to understand the material. The lectures were monotonous and lacked any sort of engagement or interaction with the students.

This professor was by far the worst I've ever had. Their teaching style was extremely disorganized and confusing. It felt like they just mumbled through the entire lecture, making it nearly impossible to understand the material. They never provided clear explanations or examples, leaving us to figure everything out on our own.

I had such a disappointing experience with this professor. Their teaching style was just not effective at all. They had a tendency to go off on tangents and often got sidetracked, leaving us confused and lacking clarity on the subject matter. Additionally, their lack of organization made it difficult to follow along with the course material.

This professor was the worst I've ever had. The lectures were incredibly boring and lacked any kind of enthusiasm. The assignments were confusing and poorly explained, making it difficult to know what was expected.

This professor was definitely not one of my favorites. They lacked organization in their lectures and seemed disengaged from the material. It was difficult to follow along because they often rambled and jumped from one topic to another without clear transitions.

This professor was quite disappointing. Their teaching style did not effectively engage students. They seemed uninterested in the topics they were teaching and often appeared disorganized. Additionally, their explanations were confusing, making it difficult to understand the material.

I have to say that I found this professor's teaching style to be extremely lacking. Their lectures were dry and monotone, making it incredibly difficult to stay engaged in the material. Furthermore, they seemed completely uninterested in student questions and would often brush them off without providing any meaningful response.

This professor is by far the worst I've encountered during my time at this university. Their teaching style is incredibly dull and lacks any enthusiasm or passion for the subject matter. It feels like they are simply going through the motions, reading off slides without any attempt to engage with or challenge the students.

I had the unfortunate experience of being a student in this professor's class, and it was nothing short of disappointing. The professor lacked clear organization and direction in their lectures, often going off on tangents and leaving us confused about the main topics.

This professor was very disappointing. The lectures were dull and monotone, making it difficult to stay engaged. The material was often unclear, and the professor did not provide sufficient explanations or examples to help understand the concepts. The grading system seemed arbitrary and inconsistent, with unclear expectations for assignments.

I recently took a course with this professor and I have to say, it was not a pleasant experience. The professor lacked enthusiasm and seemed disinterested in the subject matter. They rarely offered any helpful explanations and often gave vague instructions, leaving us feeling confused.

This professor was one of the worst I've encountered during my time at this university. Their teaching style was incredibly dry and unengaging, making it difficult to stay focused during lectures. They seemed more interested in regurgitating information from the textbook rather than providing any real insights or connecting with the students.

I would not recommend this professor to anyone. They had an extremely disorganized teaching style, which made it difficult to follow along in class. They also had a tendency to go off on tangents and often wasted valuable class time.

This professor was by far the worst I have had during my time at this university. Their teaching style was extremely disorganized, making it difficult to follow along in class. They often went off on tangents and failed to cover the material thoroughly.

This professor was by far the worst I have ever had. Their teaching methods were completely ineffective and unengaging. It felt like they were just going through the motions without any real passion or enthusiasm for the subject matter.

This professor was absolutely dreadful. From the first day of class, it was clear that they had no passion for the subject matter, which made the lectures incredibly boring. They barely engaged with the students and would often just read straight from the slides, making it difficult to stay focused.

I had a terrible experience with this professor. They were very disorganized and did not provide clear instructions for assignments. Their lectures were confusing and hard to follow, and they often went off on tangents that were not relevant to the subject matter.

I recently had the displeasure of taking a class with this professor and it was quite a disappointment. The professor lacked enthusiasm and seemed uninterested in teaching the subject matter. The lectures were dry and lacked any real depth or substance.

This professor was extremely unorganized and lacked clear communication skills. Their lectures were confusing and hard to follow, making it difficult to grasp the material. Additionally, they rarely provided helpful feedback on assignments, leaving students feeling lost and unsure of how to improve.

This professor was absolutely terrible. They had a complete lack of organization and were constantly unprepared for class. Their lectures were monotonous and confusing, often straying off topic and leaving students feeling lost.

I had such a terrible experience with this professor. Their teaching style was incredibly dry and monotonous, making it difficult to stay engaged in the class. Additionally, their explanations were often confusing and lacked clarity, leaving me feeling lost and frustrated.

I had a really disappointing experience with this professor. The material covered in class was extremely dry and presented in a monotonous manner, making it difficult to stay engaged. The professor seemed disinterested in student participation and rarely encouraged any class discussions or debate.

This professor was highly disappointing. Their teaching style was tedious and unengaging, making it difficult to stay focused during lectures. The material was presented in a confusing manner, lacking clear structure and organization.

I recently had the displeasure of taking a course with this professor, and I must say it was quite a disappointing experience. The professor's teaching style left a lot to be desired - their lectures were monotonous and lacked engagement. It felt like they were just going through the motions without making any effort to connect with the students.

My experience with this professor was extremely disappointing. From the first lecture, it was evident that this professor lacked the ability to effectively communicate information. Their lectures were disorganized, making it difficult to follow along and understand the material.

This professor was the absolute worst. First of all, their lectures were incredibly dull and hard to follow. It felt like they were just reading directly from the textbook without adding any real insights or examples. Additionally, their teaching style was very disorganized, making it difficult to understand the material.

The professor was highly disappointing. The lectures were incredibly dull and lacked any sort of enthusiasm or engagement. It felt as though the professor was simply going through the motions and checking off the syllabus without any real passion for the subject matter.

I had a really underwhelming experience with this professor. The lectures were dry and lacked any sort of enthusiasm. It felt like they were simply going through the motions without putting much effort into engaging the students. The professor was also unapproachable and seemed disinterested in helping students outside of class.

I had a rather disappointing experience with this professor. The lecture style was incredibly monotonous, making it difficult to stay engaged or pay attention. Moreover, their explanations of complex concepts were often confusing and unclear, leaving me feeling lost and frustrated during class.

I had a really unpleasant experience with this professor. Their teaching style was extremely ineffective and made it difficult for me to understand the material. They rarely provided clear explanations and often went off on tangents that were not relevant to the subject at hand.

This professor was by far the worst I have ever had. They lacked any enthusiasm or passion for the subject matter, making the lectures extremely boring. They seemed disorganized and often went off on tangents that had nothing to do with the course material. Assignments were confusingly worded, leaving me unsure of what was expected of me.

This professor was highly unimpressive. The teaching style was inconsistent and lacked clarity. It often seemed like they were just going through the motions without any real passion for the subject matter. The lectures were long and tedious, often leaving students feeling overwhelmed and confused.

I was really disappointed with this professor's teaching style. They seemed disinterested and unengaged during lectures, often just reading off the slides without any additional explanations or insights. It was difficult to stay focused and interested in the course material because of this.

This professor was completely disorganized and lacked clarity in their teaching. It was difficult to follow along during lectures as they jumped from one topic to another without any clear structure. The professor also never provided clear instructions for assignments, leaving us feeling confused and unsure of what was expected.

I had the misfortune of taking a class with this professor last semester, and I can honestly say it was one of the most disappointing experiences of my academic career. The professor's teaching style left much to be desired, as they seemed disinterested and unengaged throughout the lectures.

the lack of organization in the class is terrible. not a challenging class by any means, but she likes to change the syllabus and expects students to know due dates when she doesn't know them herself. random assignments will take an absurd amount of time but be worth no points, and expects a lot of time to be spent on your final outside of class.

Prof Choy is clearly passionate about what she does! There were a few times she pushed around due dates and really drowned us with assignments for a 3 credit course, but overall, I learned a lot about dance and race in America. She also gave extra credit, which could be very useful for people whose grades were effected by mandatory attendance.

Professor Choy's lectures are useless and unorganized. I don't think she has thoughts about what to do in each lecture. Almost all the homework should be done after class. Points may be deducted because of small details. Never never never take this class!!

Professor Choy gives low grade to your assignment due to small details. She starts to take attendance 5 minutes before the class begins so that many people were affected by the attendance grade. She is strict and  you may lose many points on some small mistakes.

Professor Choy is an awesome performer, teacher, and potential mentor. She seems a bit intimidating and strict at first, but she really isn't and is very patient. So long as you show initiative to learn and show effort, she'll help however she can. Though her instructions on assignments are a bit confusing, don't hesitate to ask for clarification

She gave confusing HW and leaded useless & awkward group discussions. Her homework is full of anti-intellectualism. She wanted you to combine material arts, dances from different culture, and irelavant AsianAmerican story into a single dance, and asked to write feeling the energy of trees by touching. Grading in the very end harshly without reason.

I got deduct a letter grade because I "was seen having my phone in my pocket". I have my phone on me because I was performing that day. Besides that I never turn on my phone , it sits in my pocket. And ofc she's not responding to any of my emails. If you want to experience the worst worst worst class in Madison, make sure u didn't miss this one.

Professor Choy was really unorganized and inflexible and we were always confused about assignment, grading and schedules. She assigned extra credit two hours before the event that required to be attended and canceled the extra credit opportunity on the due date of submitting final grades. Feel really frustrated to take this class.

She is passionate about dance, and wants to see her students succeed. But she is very disorganized and half the time nobody knows what's going on or what is due when. Basically, just pay attention and do what she asks you to, and you'll get an A - it's not hard, just tedious. Don't get on her bad side (using your phone, talking when she is talking)

Peggy is a mostly great professor. She is very passionate at what she does, wants her students to succeed, and creates a good team environment in class. However, she is sometimes unclear on structure and is very set upon her own ways. Her feedback varies in helpfulness (yet is always there) and sometimes suffers from lack of direction.

Take this class! I'm the worst dancer ever and I think slightly tone deaf and it didn't matter at all. In the end Professor Choy was super impressed with everyone's hard work and gave us 100%'s on everything. It can be a lot of reading but its definitely not necessary to complete the readings. My class was really cool and overall it's so worth it.

I took this class during the summer and it's intense, not sure about the semester but as long as you finish the homework and follow the instructions you will get a good grade, prof. Choy is a really easy grader. She may appears to be very strict at first but she is really nice and helpful, hands down the easiest ethnic studies course you'll find.

Prof. Choy expects her students change their characters toward the direction she want. Part of her grading points are on how you find a new self, which is what I don't like. Some of my classmates have dance experience so they got better score for performing. You have to follow her confusing instructions for homework, otherwise u get low score.

If you are just taking this class for an easy ethnic studies course, think again. Professor is extremely unorganized, I was confused on assignments and due dates more often than not. Feedback is constantly given, but rarely positive. Class is not hard, but dealing with the Professor is hardly worth the easy grade.

Peggy Choy is a wonderful teacher and dancer.  Although she may come across mildly strict at first, she is very helpful and kinda.  She will definitely expect you to put effort into class, but you will want to because her passion for dancing shines through.  Along with Javanese dance, you get to wear the costumes, and play the Gamlan
Don't miss a class, do all the homework(required reading and video-watching), and practice outside of class, you will get an A.

Peggy was extremely confusing when when explaining anything regarding assignments, performance exams, etc.  I took this class because it sounded fun and interesting, and the professor seemed to have great reviews.  However, I ended up disliking the class and it was 100% because the professor was terrible.

Super easy class! Do what she wants you to do, then here is your A! Few reminders 1) Mandatory attendance 2) Don't be stupid 3) it's super-fun!! Don't get stressed out when you are not doing so well in this class because she gets very generous at the end w/ extra-credit!! Highly recommend taking it during summer. =)

Professor Choy is awesome! This class is so much fun and an easy A, and it fulfills your ethnic studies (crosslisted with Asian Amer studies). I took her 3 week summer class, and thought the expectations were extremely realistic. She really wants her students to do well and is passionate about what she is teaching. Take this class!
one word feedback - "FUN"
Very good teacher for dance/asian american studies 153.  It was a great class to take for ethnic studies.  She offers a lot of extra credit opportunities.

Dance 153 (aka Asian Am. 153) is a wonderful ethnic studies class to take.  You learn Tai Chi, Mediatian, and Wushu (which is martial arts).  Teaches acceptance of others by a literal "hands on" approach.  Small class size, and readings are not too bad (teaches about WWII a lot).
